page.title: 20An Australian Viewpoint
page.content: We are the Nulty family from Alice Springs, Australia, on a teacher- exchange visit to Ridgeway for 1 year. Our main impression is of the compactness of your country. The houses are smaller with upstairs floors and often attached to each other. The streets are narrower, cars smaller and shops in many cases smaller too. It is surprising to find villages and farms so near to a city. The English appreciate gardens and parks more than we do. The climate is obviously a big difference, but we love your long summer evenings. We miss our utility room and pumpkins, and HATE mushy peas.
